Articles.Content:
I read that the original promise giving early adopters a free copy of the game would be upheld, but I've yet to see anything on it.

A) Has anyone seen how we're supposed to get the unlock, and would you kindly post a link?

B) I think Take-Two could do a bit better at letting folks know how to handle this.  I would have expected either a new post or an update to the announcement once they got this worked out.

I've bought a lot of copies of KSP, and will buy plenty of the expansion, as gifts for my nieces and nephews.  I'm not demanding it because I don't want to pay for it, but just because it's a nice nod of appreciation for those who have been around since the beginning.   Besides, there may be early adopters who can't afford it, and they deserve to play on release day, too.

 

Thanks!
look here your question is answered...
I can't believe that they waited until launch to tell us we will need to email support, I guess I will not be playing the DLC for another week...
Locking the thread as it has been answered.
